user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of SHA1PadMessage:
```c
static void
SHA1PadMessage (struct SHA1Context *context)
{
  if (context->message_block_index > 55)
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 64)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
    SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  else
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  context->message_block[56] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 24);
  context->message_block[57] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 16);
  context->message_block[58] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 8);
  context->message_block[59] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high);
  context->message_block[60] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 24);
  context->message_block[61] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 16);
  context->message_block[62] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 8);
  context->message_block[63] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low);
  SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the statement is a call to a user‑defined function (SHA1ProcessMessageBlock) and not one of the <string.h> functions named by MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. The rule applies to uses of memcpy/memmove/memset/strncmp/strcpy/etc.; the call itself cannot be determined to violate that rule. A possible violation scenario would be if SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (or a function it calls) invokes a <string.h> function such as memcpy/memset/strcpy with a size/length argument that exceeds the bounds of context->message_block (e.g. memcpy(context->message_block, src, n) where n > sizeof(context->message_block)).
